summary: The U.S. military services preposition their assets—including combat vehicles, rations, medical supplies, and repair parts—on land and on the water at strategic locations around the world. The Department of Defense uses these assets for combat, to support allies, and for disaster and humanitarian assistance. DOD does not have a complete picture of the services' prepositioning programs. Improved joint oversight would allow DOD to better identify...
title: Warfighter Support: DOD Needs a Complete Picture of the Military Services' Prepositioning Programs
